translation:
Dear Bernardina Piratini, March 30, 1838.

Having only written what is seen above, to dispatch the Lord to there, I receive yours of the 28th of this month and another from the godfather with the same date: I am therefore pleased with the health condition of our children, yet tears came to my eyes upon the position of your brother.

God wills it so; it is our duty to respect His decrees. Last night, without expecting it, the appointment to again occupy the position I had left came to my hands: judge for yourself how much this incident must have disturbed me! I have already pledged my friendship and services to the President and the Republic to be excused from such an employment; nothing has been granted; however, I shall still remain firm until you tell me what I should do about it: for despite seeing my adversaries falter, and the slanders they hurled at me disproved, still my repugnance is invincible.

By the mulatto, I will send you all that you request, as well as what your father asks, whom you will comfort to receive with resignation the blow that heaven prepares for him.

I would esteem that our children are not in danger, especially Bruto, whose loss would throw me into despair: embraces to all, regards to your father, mother, and brothers, and receive the heart of Almeida.

Madam. Feliz Retiro.
